summary: Users want to separate workflow code bundling from worker execution, allowing them to use custom bundlers (like esbuild) instead of the built-in webpack bundler and trigger only code execution on startup.
userImpact: Users can now use their preferred bundling tools instead of being locked into the built-in bundler, enabling more flexible development workflows.
rootCause: The worker entrypoint was tightly coupled to both bundling and execution logic, preventing users from customizing the bundling step.
proposedFix: Export WorkflowCodeBundler class and add workflowCodeBundle parameter to WorkerOptions, accepting either bundled code string or path to bundle file.
resolutionDetails: The feature was implemented by exporting bundling functionality separately and adding workflowCodeBundle parameter to Worker.create options.
keyQuote: I'd like to take the responsibility of the bundling (and e.g. use something like esbuild instead of Webpack) and have my worker entrypoint only trigger the actual code execution
